content.value: Below are multiple game modes for Fortnite: Battle Royale, players must read the modes and understand how the game modes are played. All game modes involve us matching you with an opponent where you add your opponents EPIC ID and play one of our competitive modes.

content.title: Kills While Downed
content.value: All kills will count

content.title: Reviving
content.value: Van respawns are allowed. Kills scored by a respawned player, opponent or teammate, WILL COUNT.

content.title: Lag/Settings
content.value: After 10 seconds of landing and touching ground, any complaints on lag or pre-game settings will not be taken into consideration. There are no exceptions for this. A team must leave within 10 seconds due to lag from landing/start, and it will be replayed if they can provide proof of lag and leaving the match. For 2v2 matches both players must leave within 10 seconds. If this is a matchfinder match and your opponent refuses to replay you must provide proof of lag and leaving within 10 seconds then OCG admins will determine if the match gets cancelled. If, however, in that time you get damaged by another player, pick up items, or your opponent gets a kill/knock the match will stand from that point on. If after this point a player disconnects from the match, the match will not be replayed or cancelled. Any players enrolling in tournaments or matches, you agree to these terms. Valid proof of lag must include video in-game evidence of skipping or freezing, etc.

content.title: Kill Stealing
content.value: Kill-stealing is allowed. “Stealing” kills is apart of the competitive nature of the match.

content.title: Interference/Sabotage
content.value: In general, you are prohibited to intentionally interfere with your opponents attempts to secure kills or move around the map.

list: Attracting other opponents by firing guns around your teammate(which is your OCG match opponent).
Causing your opponents to miss shots.
Building around or in front of your opponent (intentionally preventing their movement)
Following your teammate (which is your OCG opponent).
Shooting down your own structures and launch pad (if you built them).
Boxing yourself in a loot crate or chest.

content.value: Keep in mind that this is a list of examples and is not all-inclusive. There are other possibilities of interference. We do our very best to provide a consistent and fair experience for all players, but as previously mentioned all interference calls are strictly at the discretion of OCG admins.

If you lose a match and believe that resulted because of your opponent interfering with your game play in a prohibited way, dispute the match by reporting you won. Then upload proof and explain in the dispute ticket exactly what happened. Video proof is the only valid proof considered. Proof must be clear for us to forfeit the other team for the match.

list: In OCG Kill Race matches the objective is to get more kills than your opponent in a public lobby of Fortnite. In a 1v1 match, you and your opponent will go together into a Duos lobby, in a 2v2 you go together into a Squads lobby and compete to see who can get the most kills.
In a Best of 1 (1nD) match, if the scores result in being tied, the match must be replayed with the original host.

In a Best of 3 match all maps must be plays and all kills will be added together to determine who had the most. The team with the most kills out of all three maps is the winner of the match. If there is a tie in the kills at the end of the three maps another map must be played. The team who did not host the previous map will host the final map this will occur until a winner is determined by leading in kills.
Under any circumstances, if the score is tied you play again until a winner is determined by leading in kills. This also includes if the score is 0-0.
Kills While Downed: All kills will count.

content.title: Disconnections
content.value: If a player disconnects in the pre-game warm up, the game must be replayed. If a player disconnects once the game has started, it is considered a death. The player who disconnected score is equal to the number of kills at the time of disconnection. The opposing player may continue to finish playing the match after you disconnected.

list: In a 1v1, the hosting team will start a Battle Royale Duo match. In a 2v2 the hosting team will start a Battle Royale Squads match
In OCG Survival Deathmatch mode it is based on WHO LASTS THE LONGEST, the team that is the last standing or last to go down will receive the win.
If the game is won (Victory Royale) and both teams are still standing/alive the team that got the most kills for the match will win.
If the match is won (Victory Royale) and the kills are TIED with both teams having a standing member, the map will be replayed to determine the winner.
Getting your opponent killed by drawing attention to them can result in a forfeit for that map if valid proof is submitted.
All kills received after death are considered a valid kill.

list: If a match is played out for over 2 minutes any complaints on lag will not be taken into consideration.

If any unplayable lag occurs record all proof of the match and how it affected you and was unplayable. A Support Ticket Admin will decide if you put enough effort into dispute ticket,after the match our  admin will decide which team wins or if match is cancelled.

If there is any type of in-game glitch purposely being used by an opponent to give them an advantage it is up to the admin to decide to cancel the match based off the proof you submit. Play the match to completion and proof will be necessary and should be clear in-game DVR captured evidence.

If a player disconnects during a match, the match must be restarted within 10 minutes from the time of disconnection. Once the match is restarted players continue with the amount of time that was remaining from disconnect. Players will use the same score from the time of disconnection. Users will play the remainder of the match in the first half and any remaining time in the second half, if needed. I.E, If quarters are 5 minutes each and the player disconnected at 7 minutes into the first half then the players will start in the first half and play 3 minutes in the second half. This will add up to full game time of all four quarters.
If a player disconnects during a pause timer match will be continued at the same score and time of the disconnection.
If a player disconnects in the first quarter, the match will be resumed with standing scores before the disconnect.
If a team is losing by 14 points or more and disconnects in the second half that team who disconnected will forfeit the match.
If an opponent disconnects from a match and does not contact or invite you to lobby within 10 minutes that will result in a forfeit of the match.

When continuing the match from a disconnection: players must use the same teams, time and score from previous match. If the match is played out to completion on the wrong teams the match will be valid.

content.value: Chew clock is an IN-game option that is available to any team picking an offensive play. Chew will bring the play clock down after the offensive play is selected. It is ALLOWED to chew at any time and is not disputable. Any team that disputes for opponent chewing the clock will lose the dispute.

If you are “Kicked for Excessive Griefing” when the match is tied or you are losing a match, you automatically forfeit the match. If you are kicked when you are winning, the match will be cancelled. If either player is kicked prior to the first quarter and scores are tied, it will be considered not an issue and the match will be replayed.

Example: “Ice Kait” is the same character as “Armored Kait” If any team is caught using two of the same characters in a map it will result in a forfeit for that map.
Any single COG team is only allowed to have two female characters.
